main event: On 24 June 1949, two unidentified saucer-shaped objects were observed in the sky over Astoria, Long Island, New York.
interesting points: The objects were grayish and surrounded by a yellow halo of light., They traveled in an easterly direction and disappeared into haze after three seconds., The objects were described as being approximately 1.5 to 2 feet in diameter., The sighting was conducted by Mrs. Scalfo, a clerk-bookkeeper with a stable character., A single-engine fighter aircraft was seen circling the area shortly after the sighting.
witness description: Mrs. Scalfo, a stable individual not prone to exaggeration or verbosity.
